main_definition: The external parts of the human body that are used for hearing sounds.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used in idioms to refer to someone's ability to hear or understand information, usually through conversation.
meanings_and_examples.example: He keeps his ears open during meetings so he can catch all the details.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Referring to a person who listens attentively and is good at understanding others' perspectives.
meanings_and_examples.example: She has such sharp ears; she always knows what people are really thinking.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An expression indicating that one pays close attention to what someone else is saying, often out of curiosity or interest.
meanings_and_examples.example: I was listening with great interest when he explained his new business idea.
